description: If removed, it will be automatically added again.

tip: Note: Add all completions may cause PowerShell to load slowly for the start up.
It's recommended to add as needed rather than adding all completions.

root.name: alias
tip: Manage the alias that triggers completion.

next.name: add
tip: Add one or more alias for the specified completion.

root.name: completion
tip: Specify the configuration for a completion.
By default, each completion comes with multiple special configurations: {{ $PSCompletions.default_completion_item -join ' | ' }} (Require hooks)

root.name: config
tip: Get/Set the configuration of the module.

next.name: enable_auto_alias_setup
tip: Automatically use 'Set-Alias' to add aliases defined by 'psc alias'.

next.name: enable_cache
tip: It will make the completion load faster, and it's recommended to keep the default.

next.name: enable_completions_update
tip: Show remote completion status notification when import module.
Note: It's not recommended to disable it, because it will help you get the latest update information in time.

next.name: enable_module_update
tip: Show module version update notification when import module.
Note: It's not recommended to close it. The remote repository always matches the latest version of the module.

next.name: language
tip: Get or set the language of completions.
The language will affect all added completions unless you set a language for one of them by running 'psc completion xxx'.

next.name: en-US
tip: "It will use Github repo as the completion library.`nYou can also specify the source by running 'psc config url <url>'."

next.name: zh-CN
tip: "It will use Gitee repo as the completion library.`nYou can also specify the source by running 'psc config url <url>'."

next.name: url
tip: Set the url of the completion library.
The default value is "", which means use the default repository (Github/Gitee)
It means the repository will be selected based on the language (Github/Gitee).

next.name: "https://abgox.github.io/PSCompletions"
tip: Use Github Pages as the completion library.

next.name: "https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/raw/main"
tip: Use Gitee as the completion library.

next.name: "https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/raw/main"
tip: Use Github as the completion library.

root.name: list
tip: Display the completions that have been added.

options.name: --remote
tip: Display all available completions in the repository ({{ $PSCompletions.url }}).

root.name: menu
tip: Manage the configuration of the completion menu.

next.name: color_theme
tip: Toggle the built-in color theme of the module completion menu.
You can also customize it by running 'psc menu custom color'

next.name: config
tip: Some other custom configurations for the completion menu.

next.name: between_item_and_symbol
tip: Set the separator between the completion item and the symbol when there is the completion predict symbol after the completion item.

next.name: completion_suffix
tip: Set the completion suffix, which will be automatically added after applying the completion.
The default is a space, which is used to simplify unnecessary space key presses.

next.name: completions_confirm_limit
tip: Set the number of completion items beyond which a secondary confirmation box will pop up.
Only after confirmation and these completion items will be obtained.
If it's 0, it means no limit.
No matter how many completion items there are, they will be obtained directly.

next.name: enable_completions_sort
tip: Sort the completion items dynamically based on command history.
It will read the history file provided by PSReadLine.

next.name: enable_enter_when_single
tip: When there is only one completion item, enter it directly instead of displaying the module completion menu.

next.name: enable_hooks_tip
tip: For the completion items dynamically added via hooks, display their completion tip.

next.name: enable_list_follow_cursor
tip: The list of the module completion menu is displayed following the input cursor.

next.name: enable_list_full_width
tip: The list of the module completion menu is displayed with a full width.
Enable it, the performance of the completion menu will be better.

next.name: enable_list_loop
tip: The list of the module completion menu is displayed with a loop.

next.name: enable_menu
tip: Use the module completion menu provided by the PSCompletions module.
It is invalid in non-Windows systems.

next.name: enable_menu_enhance
tip: Enhance the function of the module completion menu, for example: global management of completions

next.name: enable_menu_show_below
tip: When the module completion menu needs to be displayed above the cursor, scroll the content buffer to let the cursor return to the top, and display the menu below the cursor.
It is a good solution to the problem of differences in buffer redrawing.

next.name: enable_path_with_trailing_separator
tip: Use path completion with a trailing separator.

next.name: enable_tip_follow_cursor
tip: The tip of module completion menu is displayed following the input cursor.

next.name: enable_tip_when_enhance
tip: For completions not added via 'psc add', display their completion tip.

next.name: filter_symbol
tip: Set the symbols on the left and right of the filter area in the module completion menu, which is in the top left corner.

next.name: height_from_menu_bottom_to_cursor_when_above
tip: Set the distance between the bottom of the module completion menu and the cursor when the module completion menu is displayed above.
Typically, it is used to skip the prompt line theme (oh-my-posh/starship/...) to avoid differences caused by redrawing.

next.name: height_from_menu_top_to_cursor_when_below
tip: Set the distance between the top of the module completion menu and the cursor when the module completion menu is displayed below.

next.name: list_max_count_when_above
tip: Set the maximum number of completion items to be displayed on the first page when the module completion menu is displayed above the cursor.
If it's 0, it means that it's determined by PSCompletions itself.

next.name: list_max_count_when_below
tip: Set the maximum number of completion items to be displayed on the first page when the module completion menu is displayed below the cursor.
If it's 0, it means that it's determined by PSCompletions itself.

next.name: list_min_width
tip: Set the minimum width of the completion list area in the module completion menu.

next.name: status_symbol
tip: Set the spacer between the current and total count in the module completion menu, which is in the bottom left corner.

next.name: trigger_key
tip: Setting the key that triggers the completion menu.
It will use Set-PSReadLineKeyHandler to bind the key.

next.name: custom
tip: Customize the style of the module completion menu.

next.name: color
tip: Color-related custom configurations for the module completion menu.

next.name: filter_color
tip: Foreground color of the filter box (Top left corner).

next.name: item_color
tip: Foreground color of the completion item.

next.name: selected_bgcolor
tip: BackGround color of the selected item.

next.name: selected_color
tip: Foreground color of the selected item.

next.name: status_color
tip: Foreground color of the completion count status (Bottom left corner).

next.name: tip_color
tip: Foreground color of the completion tip.

next.name: line
tip: Line-related custom configurations for the module completion menu.

next.name: bottom_left
tip: Bottom left corner of the border.

next.name: bottom_right
tip: Bottom right corner of the border.

next.name: horizontal
tip: The horizontal line of the border.

next.name: top_left
tip: Top left corner of the border.

next.name: top_right
tip: Top right corner of the border.

next.name: vertical
tip: The vertical line of the border.

next.name: line_theme
tip: Toggle the built-in border style theme of the module completion menu.
You can also customize it by running 'psc menu custom line'

next.name: bold_line_rect_border
tip: Set to a bold line rectangular border. Be like:

next.name: boldTB_slimLR_border
tip: Set the border. (Bold on top/bottom, slim on left/right.) Be like:

next.name: double_line_rect_border
tip: Set to a double line rectangular border. Be like:

next.name: doubleTB_singleLR_border
tip: Set the border. (Double line on top/bottom, single line on left/right.) Be like:

next.name: single_line_rect_border
tip: Set to a single line rectangular border. Be like:

next.name: single_line_round_border
tip: Set to a single line rounded border. Be like:

next.name: singleTB_doubleLR_border
tip: Set the border. (Single line on top/bottom, double line on left/right.) Be like:

next.name: slimTB_boldLR_border
tip: Set the border. (Slim on top/bottom, bold on left/right.) Be like:

next.name: symbol
tip: Set completion predict symbol(~?!) in the completion tip.
They only exist in completions added via `psc add`.
They are used to let you know if you can continue to get completions.

next.name: OptionTab
tip: You can hide it by the command. (psc menu symbol OptionTab "")
It can hide symbols, but it's not recommended.
It's more recommended that you modify them to your liking.
Because these symbols let you know if you can continue to get completions.

next.name: SpaceTab
tip: You can hide it by the command. (psc menu symbol SpaceTab "")
It can hide symbols, but it's not recommended.
It's more recommended that you modify them to your liking.
Because these symbols let you know if you can continue to get completions.

next.name: WriteSpaceTab
tip: You can hide it by the command. (psc menu symbol WriteSpaceTab "")
It can hide symbols, but it's not recommended.
It's more recommended that you modify them to your liking.
Because these symbols let you know if you can continue to get completions.

root.name: reset
tip: Reset the specified configuration to the default
Except for the core code of the module, all other content is removed.

next.name: alias
tip: Reset all completions or specified completions to the default completion trigger name.
Reset all completions to the default completion trigger name.

next.name: completion
tip: Reset(Remove) the special configuration of all completions or specified completions.
Reset(Remove) the special configuration of all completions.
Include all configurations under the command ('psc completion').

next.name: config
tip: Include configuration items under the command ('psc config').

next.name: menu
tip: Reset the configuration of the completion menu.
Reset all configurations of the completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu').

next.name: color
tip: Rest the color-related configurations of the module completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu custom color').

next.name: config
tip: Reset other custom configurations of the completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu config').

next.name: line
tip: Rest the line-related configurations of the module completion menu.
Include all configuration items under the command ('psc menu custom line').

next.name: order
tip: It just removes the order sort file, which will be regenerated when the next completion is triggered.
If you do not want to sort by command history, you should disable sorting by running 'psc config enable_completions_sort 0'.
Note: psc will be automatically re-added after removing.

root.name: search
tip: Search completion. (Wildcard character can be used)
Update all completions that can be updated.

options.name: --force
tip: Force update of all added completions.

done: $out = $alias | ForEach-Object { if($_ -in $conflict_alias){ '<@Magenta>' + $_+ ' <@Yellow>(It already exists. Please handle the conflict manually.)<@Magenta>' } else { '<@Magenta>' + $_ } };

min: You should continue entering the completion name you want to add.
You can enter more names, separated by spaces.
no: <@Red>Completion <@Magenta>{{ $completion }}<@Red> does not exist in the completions list.
It's recommended to enter <@Magenta>psc add<@Red>, then press <@Magenta>Space<@Red> and <@Magenta>Tab<@Red> to complete.

example: E: psc add git           --- Add git
psc add git scoop     --- Add git and scoop

err.cmd_exist: <@Red>Alias <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Red> is invalid, <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Magenta><@Red> already exists, please set other alias.
err.exist: <@Red>Alias <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Red> is invalid, <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Magenta><@Red> is already an alias for {{ $completion }}.
min_k: You should continue to enter a completion name that is already installed.
Then enter one or more alias you want to add.
min_v: You need to continue entering one or more alias that you want to add for {{ $completion }}.

example: E: psc alias add git g gi            --- Add g and gi aliases for git
psc alias add scoop scoop.ps1     --- Add scoop.ps1 alias for scoop
tip: Add one or more aliases for {{ $completion }}.

example:
E: psc alias list             --- List all aliases
   psc alias add git g gi     --- Add g and gi aliases for git
   psc alias rm git g gi      --- Remove g and gi aliases for git
E: psc alias list     --- List all aliases

min_k: You should continue to enter a completion name that is already installed.
Then enter one or more alias you want to remove.
min_v: You need to continue entering one or more alias that you want to remove for {{ $completion }}.
unique: <@Magenta>{{ $alias }}<@Red> cannot be removed because it's the only alias of <@Magenta>{{ $completion }}<@Red>.
If you want to change it, you should first add a new alias and then remove the old alias.

example: E: psc alias rm git g gi            --- Remove g and gi aliases for git
psc alias rm scoop scoop.ps1     --- Remove scoop.ps1 alias for scoop
rm.tip: Remove one or more aliases for {{ $completion }}.

tip:
Set whether to enable hooks.
The hooks will parse or generate some completion data and add them dynamically.
You can disable it by running the command (<@Magenta>psc completion {{ $completion }} enable_hooks 0<@Blue>).
Set whether the completion items dynamically added for {{ $completion }} via hooks display completion tip.
Set whether to display completion tip for {{ $completion }}.

min: You should continue to enter the configuration items to be set.
By default, each completion comes with multiple special configurations: <@Magenta>{{ $PSCompletions.default_completion_item -join '<@Yellow> | <@Magenta>' }} <@Yellow>(Require hooks)

example:
E: psc completion psc enable_tip       --- If it has a value, return the value
   psc completion psc enable_tip 0     --- Set psc completion to not display tip
   psc completion psc language zh-CN   --- Set the psc completion language to zh-CN
tip: Special configurations have higher priority than global configurations.

done:
<@Green>PSCompletions's configuration modified successfully!
<@Blue>{{ $config_item }}<@Green>: <@Magenta>{{ $PSCompletions.wrap_whitespace($old_value) }}<@Green> => <@Magenta>{{ $PSCompletions.wrap_whitespace($new_value) }}
<@Yellow>To make the change effective, may need restart PowerShell and reimport module.

example: E: psc config enable_cache 1     --- Enable cache
psc config enable_cache 0     --- Disable cache

one_or_zero: <@Magenta>{{ $config_item }}<@Yellow> just need a value, number 1 or 0.

example: E: psc config language           --- Get language
psc config language zh-CN     --- Set to zh-CN
E: psc config language           --- Get language
psc config language zh-CN     --- Set to zh-CN
E: psc config enable_module_update 1     --- Show module update
psc config enable_module_update 0     --- Hide module update
E: psc config enable_completions_update 1     --- Show completion update
psc config enable_completions_update 0     --- Hide completion update

err: <@Magenta>{{ $config_item }}<@Yellow> just need a value, a url. (https://xxx)
The url must be valid, and its directory structure should be the same as that of the repository.
example: E: psc config url                                           --- Get current url
psc config url https://abgox.github.io/PSCompletions     --- Set url

description:
<@Cyan>[Module Description]
<@Blue>PSCompletions(<@Magenta>psc<@Cyan>) --- A completion manager for a better and simpler tab-completion experience in PowerShell

<@Cyan>[Module Version]
<@Magenta>{{ $PSCompletions.version }}<@Cyan>

<@Cyan>[Module Changelog]
  Github: <@Blue>https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/module/CHANGELOG.md<@Cyan>
  Gitee : <@Blue>https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/module/CHANGELOG.md<@Cyan>

<@Cyan>[Module Usage]
Enter <@Magenta>psc<@Cyan>, press <@Magenta>Space<@Cyan> and <@Magenta>Tab<@Cyan> key, you will quickly learn all usages by reading the completion tip.
Run <@Magenta>psc<@Cyan> will display this page content again and reload the module's data and key bindings.

<@Cyan>[Module Completion Menu]
<@Blue>PSCompletions<@Cyan> provides a more powerful module completion menu. <@Yellow>(Currently only available on Windows)<@Cyan>

You can enter characters to filter, and three matching symbols are supported:
  - <@Magenta>^<@Cyan>: Match the beginning.
  - <@Magenta>?<@Cyan>: Match any single character.
  - <@Magenta>*<@Cyan>: Match one or more any characters.

Here are some key bindings:
  - Apply the selected completion item: <@Magenta>Space<@Cyan> | <@Magenta>Enter<@Cyan>
      - You can also use <@Magenta>Tab<@Cyan> when there's only one completion.
  - Delete filter characters: <@Magenta>Backspace<@Cyan>
  - Exit the module completion menu: <@Magenta>Esc<@Cyan> | <@Magenta>Ctrl + c<@Cyan>
      - You can also use <@Magenta>Backspace<@Cyan> when there're no characters in the filter area.
  - Select previous completion item:  <@Magenta>Up<@Cyan>  | <@Magenta>Shift + Tab<@Cyan> | <@Magenta>Ctrl + u<@Cyan> | <@Magenta>Ctrl + p<@Cyan> | <@Magenta>Ctrl + k<@Cyan>
  - Select   next   completion item: <@Magenta>Down<@Cyan> |     <@Magenta>Tab<@Cyan>     | <@Magenta>Ctrl + d<@Cyan> | <@Magenta>Ctrl + n<@Cyan> | <@Magenta>Ctrl + j<@Cyan>

<@Cyan>[Global Name]
<@Blue>PSCompletions<@Cyan> will take up two global names. <@Yellow>They should be read-only, and you should not modify or override them.<@Cyan>
  <@Magenta>PSCompletions<@Cyan>: A function name. The core function of the module export. <@Magenta>psc<@Cyan> is its default alias.
 <@Magenta>$PSCompletions<@Cyan>: A variable name. Save all data related to the module.

<@Cyan>[Other Content]
Website : <@Blue>https://pscompletions.abgox.com<@Cyan>
FAQ     : <@Blue>https://pscompletions.abgox.com/faq<@Cyan>
Github  : <@Blue>https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions<@Cyan>
Gitee   : <@Blue>https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions<@Cyan>

If you have a problem using it, you can submit an issue: https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/issues

If <@Blue>PSCompletions<@Cyan> is helpful to you, please consider giving it a <@Yellow>Star<@Cyan>.

deny_change_menu_line_style: <@Red>In Windows PowerShell 5.1, due to its rendering issues, the border line style of the module completion menu cannot be modified.
It is recommended to use PowerShell (pwsh) as it does not have such restrictions.

example: E: psc list              --- Display a list of locally installed completions
psc list --remote     --- Display remote completions list

done: <@Green>The color style of the module completion menu modified successfully!
example: E: psc menu color_theme Default         --- Default theme
psc menu color_theme DarkMagenta     --- Pure color theme

err.completion_suffix: <@Red>It can only be one or more spaces.
err.filter_symbol: <@Red>It must contain at least two characters.
err.v_1_or_0: <@Red>It should be the number <@Magenta>1<@Red> or <@Magenta>0<@Red>, which means enabled or disabled.
err.v_ge: <@Red>It should be an integer number greater than or equal to<@Magenta>{{ $min }}.
err.v_ge_le: <@Red>It should be an integer number greater than or equal to <@Magenta>{{ $min }}<@Red> and less than or equal to <@Magenta>{{ $max }}<@Red>.

example:
E: psc menu config enable_enter_when_single 1     --- Auto-apply when there's only one completion item
   psc menu config enable_tip 0                   --- Hide completion tip
   psc menu config enable_menu 0                  --- Disable the module completion menu
E: psc menu custom color border_color DarkGray     --- Set foreground color of the border to DarkGray
psc menu custom line horizontal ─               --- Set the horizontal line of the border to "-"

E: psc menu config enable_enter_when_single 1       --- Auto-apply when there's only one completion item
   psc menu config enable_tip 0                     --- Hide completion tip
   psc menu symbol SpaceTab ""                      --- Hide symbol
   psc menu line_theme single_line_round_border     --- Toggle the built-in border style theme of the module completion menu

done: <@Green>Completion menu border line style modified successfully!
example:
E: psc menu line_theme single_line_round_border     --- Set to a single line rounded border (default)
   psc menu line_theme single_line_rect_border      --- Set to a single line rectangular border
   psc menu line_theme double_line_rect_border      --- Set to a double line rectangular border

E: psc menu symbol SpaceTab ~
   psc menu symbol OptionTab ?
   psc menu symbol WriteSpaceTab !

module.restart: <@Yellow>To make the change effective, please restart PowerShell and reimport module.

tip:
Apply any items to confirm and obtain; otherwise, cancel.
You can use 'psc menu config completions_confirm_limit 0' to remove the limit.
You can also set a higher value to limit the number of completions.

update:
<@Cyan>[Module Update]
<@Blue>PSCompletions: <@Magenta>{{ $PSCompletions.version }} <@Cyan>=> <@Magenta>{{ $PSCompletions.config.enable_module_update }}

<@Cyan>[Module Changelog]
Github: <@Blue>https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/module/CHANGELOG.md<@Cyan>
Gitee : <@Blue>https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/module/CHANGELOG.md<@Cyan>

<@Cyan>[Update Command]
<@Magenta>Update-Module PSCompletions
Update-PSResource PSCompletions
scoop update abgox.PSCompletions
scoop update pscompletions
module.updating:
<@Cyan>Try to run the command: <@Magenta>{{ $update_cmd }}<@Cyan>
Trying to update PSCompletions module...

example:
E: psc reset alias *               --- Reset all aliases
   psc reset alias psc             --- Reset psc alias
   psc reset alias psc git bun     --- Reset psc git bun alias

E: psc reset completion *              --- Reset(Remove) the special configurations of all completions
   psc reset completion psc            --- Reset(Remove) the special configurations of psc
   psc reset completion psc language   --- Reset(Remove) this special configuration(language) of psc

done: $out += '<@Green>Reset successfully!', '<@Cyan>Here are the changes from old to new:', '------------------------------';
example:
E: psc reset *                --- Reset PSCompletions module
   psc reset menu symbol      --- Reset all symbols(~?!)
   psc reset alias psc        --- Reset psc alias
   psc reset completion psc   --- Reset(Remove) this special configuration(language) of psc
init_confirm:
<@Yellow>Reset the PSCompletions module, are you sure?
<@Red>It will delete everything except the module source code.
<@Yellow>Press <@Magenta>Enter<@Yellow> key to continue or <@Magenta>other key(Without Ctrl)<@Yellow> to cancel!

example:
E: psc reset menu *              --- Reset all menu configurations
   psc reset menu config         --- Reset menu configurations
   psc reset menu line_theme     --- Reset border line style of the module completion menu

min: You should continue entering the completion name you want to remove.
You can enter more names, separated by spaces.

example: E: psc rm git           --- Remove git
psc rm git scoop     --- Remove git and scoop

min: You should continue to enter a matching string with *.
If you do not use *, please enter the full name.
ou can also just enter * to see all available completions.

example:
E: psc search *     --- Show all installable completions
   psc search p*    --- Search for completion starting with p in the name
   psc search *p*   --- Search for completion with p in the name

sub_cmd: "<@Yellow>You should select a subcommand from the subcommand list below.`n";

done: $out = $alias | ForEach-Object { if($_ -in $conflict_alias){ '<@Magenta>' + $_+ ' <@Yellow>(It already exists. Please handle the conflict manually.)<@Magenta>' } else { '<@Magenta>' + $_ } };
example:
E: psc update                 --- Check update
   psc update *               --- Update all completions
   psc update psc             --- Update psc
   psc update psc git bun     --- Update psc,git,bun

update_info: You can hide this update tip by running <@Blue>psc config enable_completions_update 0<@Cyan>
But it's not recommended to hide it, it's a kind tip.
update_no: <@Green>All the completions are up to date!

min: You should continue to enter the name of the completion you want to find the storage location for.
You can enter more names, separated by spaces.

example: E: psc which git           --- Get the location of git
psc which git scoop     --- Get the location of git and scoop
